spans.content: Performance attribution with respect to interest rates,
We develop a method to decompose the PnL of a portfolio of assets into four parts:
(b） PnL due to interest rate changes,
(c) carry gain due to time passng,
(d）PnL due to residual market risk changes (credit risk,liquidity risk,volatility
We demonstrate the usefulness of our approach by decomposing the performance of
an FX-and interest rate-hedged negative basis position in our fund XAIA Credit
Basis II,and we apply the methodology to decompose the performance of our fund
XAIA Credit Debt Capital in the first quarter of 2022 into PnL contributions of the
denote the price ofan asset at time
the asset's currency in EUR.We assume that the asset is subject to reinvestment,which
means that potential coupon or dividend payments (if present at all) are immediately
re-invested into the asset. But we comment on the general case of distributing assets,
or even a whole portfolio of assets with frequent rebalancing，below in Section

in a decomposition of the EUR PnL of the asset in a time period
